en: Interview with Lawrence Corley of Builders for Christ, conducted by Casey Kaufman. Corley provides an overview of the organization before discussing how he was involved in the reconstruction of the Roaring Fork Baptist Church. Conducted over Zoom due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is a representative quote from the interview: "We're not seasoned workers, and so we do everything by code on purpose. And a guy like me, I would run around as an architect and I'll say, remember it's 2 nails and 2x4, 3 in a 2x6, 4 in a 2x8, and they laugh at me cause they get that lecture every year. But I want to make sure we do it by the code."

But I want to make sure we do it by the code."

Interview with Lawrence Corley, 2020-05-15 -- Roaring Fork Baptist Church
Can you state your name and tell us a little about yourself?
Can you talk about the project that your team was beginning and what transpired?
What goes into organizing so many volunteers to come together to rebuild the Roaring Fork Baptist Church?
How did you, the pastor, and the congregation decide upon the space needs? What were they looking for in terms of space? Did they want to expand?
How do you interact with the congregation during this time? Did you share your testimony with them?
How did the church finance the building materials?
After finishing the construction, what was it like for the congregation to worship there?
This was the 37th church that you team has built, can you compare this experience with the others?
Did any of the Roaring Fork parishioners express any feelings about the new building being more modern?
Is there anything else that you haven't talked about that you would like to share?

seo.title: Interview with Lawrence Corley, 2020-05-15 - Rising From the Ashes Oral Histories
